channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Gunman in truck smashes into Michigan church and opens fire, killing at least 4 and injuring 8
item.description: The FBI is leading the investigation and considered it an “act of targeted violence,” said Ruben Coleman, a special agent in charge for the bureau.

item.title: Tactics used in the Michigan church attack resemble a new ‘hybrid threat’ meant to maximize damage, security expert says
item.description: "That all creates chaos. It could create what we call a fatal funnel trying to drive people towards one location."

item.title: David Marriott reveals the correct way to pronounce the popular hotel chain—and you’ve probably been doing it wrong
item.description: The Marriott empire traces back to 1927, when David's grandfather, J. Willard Marriott, opened a nine-stool A&W root beer stand in Washington, D.C.

item.title: Investors are betting big on ‘prediction markets’ Kalshi and Polymarket—will the gamble pay off?
item.description: The two startups generated huge buzz by accurately predicting the 2024 election results. Their young founders still face long odds.

item.title: What Taylor Swift taught RBC CEO Dave McKay
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: GSK is replacing its CEO with an insider and shares are flying
Day trading is about to get a lot easier for beginners. Things could get ugly.
U.S. stock futures higher after a losing week as possible shutdown looms
Morgan Stanley slashes rating on Novo Nordisk, says Alzheimer trial will fail
Why the last thing the stock market wants right now is a government shutdown
